title: ISic000080. Funerary inscription for an Abbot (?)
body:
Facsimile Images

[Hic requies]ciṭ
[in pace fam]ulus D(e)i
[---a]bba[s]
[qui vixit an(nos)] p̣ḷ(us) [m(inus)---]

Apparatus criticus

Text of Rizzone 2009, with minor modification line 4 (after photo); Isler: CII;
line.2: Isler: [Pa]ulus(?); Isler, Bivona: D(omin)i
line.4: Isler: [---].I[---]; Rizzone [qui vixit an(nos)] pl(us) m(inus)[---]

English translation

Here lies in peace the servant of God, Abbot [(name)], who lived [--] years, more or less

Italian translation

Qui giace in pace il servo di Dio [---] abate, che visse piu o meno anni [--]

commentary

Rizzone 2009 reconstructs this as a rare record (for Sicily) of a member of a monastic order, in the context of discussing a funerary inscription from Mineo (ISic003454) which appears to record a monk.

bibliography

  • Bivona 1997-1998 613 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002144
  • Isler 1994 30-31 fig.13 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001910
  • Rizzone 2009 433 fig.4 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001634
